page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: Frosterley is basically a single main street, following the course of the River Wear from West to East. It widens out at the East end to enclose the original{village green.} Most of the houses are built of stone, and some have small gardens in front. To the South there are a few{terraces}of houses. At either end of the village are{council house estates,}Westfield and Stockley Grove, all with gardens. There are housing clusters at Hill End, Bridge End, Bishopley and White Kirkley and Whitfield Brow. Isolated medieval{farms,}post-Enclosure 18th century farms, with the long house facing South, & incorporating barns,& 19th century detached farmhouses are found.Only a few houses, including{old {people's bungalows}have been built in recent years;except for infilling, there is no sign of future development
